elements.2211.03045_ba0a512221da49425bfef94556ce9: Majorana bound states (MBS) at the end of nanowires have been proposed as one of the most important candidate for the topological qubits.
elements.2211.03045_e1a1f2f5bc53ae570049951c67acf: However, similar tunneling conductance features for both the MBS and Andreev bound states (ABS) have turned out to be
elements.2211.03045_e4fe023c8d0b7c5ce8af37ce397e8: a major obstacle in the verification of the presence of MBS in semiconductor-superconductor heterostructures
elements.2211.03045_99b0bc03ee63df9ca1b60b484baaa: In this article, we use a protocol to probe properties specific to the MBS and use it to distinguish the topological zero-bias peak (ZBP) from a trivial one
elements.2211.03045_f091f6d240d63c863791f742d0355: For a scenario involving quantized ZBP in the nanowire, we propose a scheme
elements.2211.03045_e64fb036aee053db6295562d50e83: wherein the length of the topological region in the wire is altered
elements.2211.03045_b7e4d5d3a807000abde06e87f1720: The tunneling conductance signatures can then be utilized to gauge the impact
elements.2211.03045_037e5d96b2c7a4bad809f1b394360: on the energy of the low-energy states
elements.2211.03045_5f71c653dc5a00a86ce8aa466649c: We show that the topological and trivial ZBP behave differently under our protocol, in particular, the topological ZBP remains robust at zero bias throughout the protocol, while the trivial ZBP splits into two peaks at finite bias
elements.2211.03045_435716e4a8796a3ce27a894f5ddb1: This protocol probes the protection of near zero energy states due to their separable nature, allowing us to distinguish between topological and trivial ZBP.
elements.2211.03045_2a7481ca851f10233979e675ef066: The Kitaev's one-dimensional topological superconducting model
elements.2211.03045_25c0d2548e7261329aaff3a6e9fa2: Majorana modes at the ends of the 1D chain
elements.2211.03045_6ba9abd56ceaa358f2e7f0beadb81: These well separated states form robust nonlocal fermionic states and in addition under braiding the Majorana states obey non-abelian statistics,
elements.2211.03045_38f77c2b2927aa06eca8907c31a0c: thus potentially providing an ideal base for fault-tolerant topological quantum computation
elements.2211.03045_c0e3ca14e70e4d28651b0107980fc: Since then number of theoretical proposals have been made for potentially realizing systems that could host the Majoranas
elements.2211.03045_b4ef2d926dcd4e7868e55616da5c9: Some of the earliest proposals include, fractional quantum Hall states at filling
elements.2211.03045_43f092c346b1fa1c27a3d223ab0a1: superconductors with the cores hosting Majoranas
elements.2211.03045_971f60f00cab3fa6ca862240c4a6e: Others include, the cores of superconducting vortices present on the surface of a 3D topological insulator proximitized to s-wave superconductor
elements.2211.03045_c8d0e5c4a6a04f2dfc8ecc58eb4da: a semiconductor film with spin-orbit interaction and proximity coupled to an s-wave superconductor and
elements.2211.03045_9d5d59b8e85689b973f3488800a77: , in a quantum-wire with strong spin-orbit interaction proximity coupled to superconductor in the presence of magnetic-field
elements.2211.03045_566b3bd834b41acfc305a7d3f0a24: which drives the system from a trivial phase with a finite gap to a topological phase containing a zero-energy MBS in the gap.
elements.2211.03045_cfcfbdb784ff136875f7a5c21648e: Intensive experimental efforts have been made on realizing the above setups, in particular the last setup involving InAs, InSb, etc., quantum wires have been quite promising
elements.2211.03045_139d9954fc4a6db8a3342a6f3b3a1: Of all the signatures of MBS, the overwhelming emphasis has been on experimentally detecting the zero-bias tunneling conductance and their corresponding interpretation
elements.2211.03045_0ef07e7a20ced941029f015de4e52: \cite{Das_Sharma_Sengupta_Midgap_edge_state_2001, Das_sharma_Setiawan_ZBP_Electron_temp_and_tunnel_coupling_dependence, Yu_Forlov_non_MBS_nearly_quantized_2021, Pan_Das_sharma_Physical_mechanism_ZBP_2020, Vuik_Akmerov_Reproducing_topological_2019, Pan_Das_Sharma_Generic_quantized_ZBP_2020, Chen_Akmerov_Ubiquitous_non_Majorana_ZBP_2019, Woods_Stanescu_Zero_energy_pinning_trivial_BS_2019, Vernek_Subtle_leakage_of_Majorana_2014, Grivnin_MZM_2019, Moore_Tiwari_Quantized_ZBP_trivial_2018, Huang_Sau_Das_sharma_Metamorphosis_ABS_to_MBS_2018, Setiawan_Das_Sharma_Electron_temp_dependance_ZBP_2017, Nichele_Flensberg_Scaling_Majorana_ZBP_2017, Kammhuber_Wimmer_Conductance_halical_states_2017, Reeg_Zero_energy_ABS_2018, Liu_Sau_Das_Sharma_ABS_vs_MBS_ZBP_2017, Cayao_SNS_2015, Zhang_Balastic_SC_SM_nanowire_2017, higginbotham_parity_2015, Dmytruk_Pinning_2020, Liu_Sau_Das_sharma_Role_of_dissipation_MBS_2017, Prada_Transport_2012, Lee_ZBA_2012, prada_andreev_2020, san_majorana_2016, Deng_Flensberg_MBS_in_QD_hybrid_nanowire_2016,Song_Large_ZBP_2022, avila_non_hermitian_2019}
elements.2211.03045_646f277508a7890e41b7279f955d4: From the theoretical perspective, tunneling at the edge of the topological superconductor (where the MBS are localized)
elements.2211.03045_f6db20e2f0d0cd9cc598e87108c92: results in a resonant effect, consequently the Zero-bias peak (ZBP) conductance is expected to acquire the quantized value of
elements.2211.03045_d8879480c878f5e36cc82adf69235: Previous studies have shown that the ZBP can also appear due to the Andreev bound states (ABS), with the peak height close to the quantization values
elements.2211.03045_8073078f497725cb077d248440f21: The origin of ABS is often due to inhomogeneous profiles and quantum dots at the wire's end and many a times they mimic MBS's tunneling signatures.
elements.2211.03045_392be4ba62ccc3b2c4d23b47fa84a: The typical ABS consists of overlapping Majorana components, making them very sensitive to parameter changes
elements.2211.03045_cb311c60599cbcbb4a47ec10f9a50: Therefore, the ZBP due to the ABS
elements.2211.03045_48d57bd49fd18e25f17058ffd7ea1: can generally be attributed to the fine tuning of the parameters and hence not robust
elements.2211.03045_fa0e04624def9bdba919304e52160: Recent theoretical works have shown that the trivial in-gap states can actually be pinned close to zero energy for an extended range of parameter space for certain inhomogeneous profiles, making the ZBP robust
elements.2211.03045_361c0339e295a2a61c5bbf224bf6c: These ABS have their Majorana components partially separated (termed as the ps-ABS) from each other
elements.2211.03045_823c1bda79de27ea7f1604b541e25: On the other hand, for magnetic field strengths greater than the critical value, the wire will be in the topological regime wherein the Majorana components are completely separated and localized at the two ends of the wire.
elements.2211.03045_069177e23f714d65ebe6ca0f04528: It turns out that the ps-ABS appear just before the critical Zeeman term, thus it is challenging to unambiguously pin the origin of the ZBP as arising from either the topological or the trivial states
elements.2211.03045_5911567882c73cc6933f2dc7d4589: To distinguish them, use of two leads each placed at the opposite ends of the wire have been proposed as they can measure the correlations between the conductance from the two local leads
elements.2211.03045_d36389bdda6a94ff970981ec74b1d: In addition, this setup can be used to probe non-local conductances which arise
elements.2211.03045_77b2bccb5476360ce71f677fe32dc: due to the bulk states and can produce the band gap closing signature at the topological phase transition point beyond which MBS appears
elements.2211.03045_7a16a0f5b13011a9e34a088d833e0: , the presence of inhomogeneities like quantum dots at both the ends can yield correlated trivial ZBP in both the local conductances.
elements.2211.03045_2145da783e9a7bfbe693aaf627c30: It turns out that the non-local conductance signatures in case of the heterostructures are not strong enough to unambiguously depict the band gap closing.
elements.2211.03045_8f01feae515de1d8d1eafc1de352e: Besides the above, dephasing, leakage dynamics of Majorana
elements.2211.03045_5b231b93365fb11bee2b46e16d781: and recent studies focused on the robustness of quantization of ZBP with respect to tunneling barrier height and temperature
elements.2211.03045_521b858c9688d88f7b71fc9e86275: have been suggested as potential schemes to distinguish the topological Majorana modes from the Andreev states.
elements.2211.03045_52ba1da9e0880f4c1be57c31a0d3d: As mentioned in the preceding paragraph the presence of quantized ZBP is insufficient to conclude the existence of MBS as trivial ABS can also produce quantized ZBP
elements.2211.03045_3780df1342215835b9715433fe8b4: To distinguish topological states from normal zero-modes, one needs to go beyond the presence of Quantized ZBP and probe properties specific to MBS only.
elements.2211.03045_cfe561e6f8ebd8293903dd2838099: Consider that the ends of a wire are moved into trivial parameter space by changing the topological length of the wire; in such a case, one produces a trivial-topological-trivial structure with the MBS still present at the edge of the topological region
elements.2211.03045_e73cab311a6268db7b4886db05967: This property specific to the MBS has been proposed before for Majorana braiding protocols
elements.2211.03045_14e0f6adaa4c20c672c422f4d9b5a: Motivated by this, we define the "moving protocol" to systematically decrease the topological length by fixing the wire's ends in a parameter regime below the topological range by either reducing the Zeeman term or the external potential
elements.2211.03045_758ea7c01cba8b0314e0de9ab7d04: We employ "Zeeman moving protocol" (ZMP) by applying Zeeman term profile and "Potential moving protocol" (PMP) with external potential in our numerical simulation.
elements.2211.03045_d43e860ab69422c8215dc15174ed3: Since local conductance measures the local property of the wire close to the lead, the effect of change in the topological region should be apparent in the local conductance
elements.2211.03045_0eb8941f61cf1d60b84629c24348b: We apply both the protocol to diverse scenarios and investigate their impact on the trivial and the topological ZBP
elements.2211.03045_54f665f186278cb59916242cc9d2d: We show that the topological ZBP from MBS remains robust under the moving protocol
elements.2211.03045_162b7269cec6ac41bfc9d3a6f8312: At the same time, the trivial ZBP from ps-ABS has entirely different behaviour, splitting into two separate peaks at finite bias
elements.2211.03045_d559a7d1c5cb7832f09276cbb19af: This difference in behavior arises due to the fundamental difference between the MBS and ps-ABS in the overlap of their Majorana components
elements.2211.03045_d2c27f6028387e14aea3458652126: Our "moving protocol" indirectly probes this separable nature of the Majorana components.
elements.2211.03045_b4d0017a086008d30683f7e32b72e: We also show that the PMP is more effective compared to ZMP as far as distinguishing trivial and topological ZBPs are concerned, moreover, the practical implementation of this scheme is also relatively more feasible.

elements.2211.03045_38e9303c502fa16d1c78345b4e86b: This feature has a simple explanation due to the property of the MBS
elements.2211.03045_bf7b876c8668a3cb330019759924e: Application of the moving protocol changes the topological length of the wire and therefore the MBS moves further away from the lead while always staying at the edge of the topological region
elements.2211.03045_ecad265026c6ec382725fffbac361: Since the edge states move further away from the lead the coupling between the lead and the MBS decreases, resulting in the reduced width of the ZBP
elements.2211.03045_fd71607beef9e51ae1e417945a232: For sufficiently large separation between the lead and the edge mode, the ZBP disappears altogether
elements.2211.03045_4ea2ea7b81d575b2933c8a4e38016: Through out this protocol the Majorana components remain spatially separated,
elements.2211.03045_670a986e96a7885f0690c742f96a9: as a result the MBS remains at the zero energy causing the peak to be at zero bias through out this protocol.
elements.2211.03045_c94ed3844cf99a58fe39b63f28476: In quantum wires it is difficult to achieve a scenario wherein the parameters are homogeneous through out the length of the wire
elements.2211.03045_c264c6c88a721635c8984f96e5d4d: Instead, the inhomogeneous profile in the heterostructure better captures the realistic scenario.

elements.2211.03045_72ebeb9571cc7862382ba9d270844: , external potential can also be used to modify the topological length of a nanowire and produce a trivial-topological-trivial structure
elements.2211.03045_4d51281776bdf0f5c64029be15d41: In earlier works, this strategy has been suggested in the context of braiding protocol
elements.2211.03045_34fe4ecacbdbb6c4f1e27d143bf09: However, a moving protocol with tunneling measurements at the edges has not been considered before for the purpose of distinguishing topological states from trivial ones

elements.2211.03045_593ac3e8cb49d27054e4bbd9f0baa: This shortcoming of ZMP is mainly due to the reliance on the local probes to pick the energy split signature
elements.2211.03045_f7bddfa847fc2414310aa340efbf1: The protocol moves the states away from the lead, which causes the signature to disappear

elements.2211.03045_1315149da99089299266a4430f11d: We want to stress the fact that both moving protocols can induce energy splitting in trivial zero energy states, but as we use local tunneling conductance probe to detect this splitting the PMP is better at capturing the split as well as the robustness in the ZBP.
elements.2211.03045_ec0d01f340723af3e89f636203f73: In this article, we have reproduced the tunneling conductance signatures from heterostructures and have verified the inability of local and non-local conductance to distinguish ABS from the MBS
elements.2211.03045_5cf26631145ba2a4255f7f3917229: Since both the trivial and non-trivial zero energy states produce a quantized ZBP in local conductance, we focus on the effects of the topological length of the nanowire on the ZBP
elements.2211.03045_c10ed3e2d6029b1961044c3ba1890: We show that by applying the moving protocol, the trivial and topological ZBP behaves differently
elements.2211.03045_e15c40668820ccca710f449428748: As the Majorana component of trivial and topological states are fundamentally different, the protocol affects them differently
elements.2211.03045_c600147f69f34fdcd9c0766c207a5: For MBS, the Majorana components are entirely separated and localized at the edges of the topological region
elements.2211.03045_31e5422bdbf48b23100ae7c6ce187: The Majorana components move away from the wire's edges when the protocol is applied, however they remain separated and are therefore pinned at zero energy, causing the peak in local conductance to remain at zero bias throughout the protocol.
elements.2211.03045_30ebd454c27f9a3dc12ce78ef329b: For trivial zero energy states when the protocol is applied, the overlap between the partially separated Majorana components increases, causing the trivial states to move away from zero energy
elements.2211.03045_39669c6fecaac78f8a32fda2aacc3: As a result, the trivial ZBP splits into two peaks
elements.2211.03045_37ed41d7f7efbbc2a4e5797fdda8a: This effect of moving protocol on topological and trivial ZBP remains the same irrespective of the method of reducing the topological length by putting certain portion of the wire in a trivial regime
elements.2211.03045_28906a450ca5dfc4784729ce4d2f8: We compare the results of ZBP under ZMP and PMP in our numerical simulation
elements.2211.03045_43cb8a0ef762163591f53ca6e817c: We discuss the shortcoming of the moving protocol in the S
elements.2211.03045_1d6b61074ac7b94926825c2e679ed: system, the origin of which is due to the reliance on the local measurements to detect the split in energy
elements.2211.03045_57006a8937612acc87fbd831afd0a: As the states are moved further away from the lead the splitting information is less pronounced in tunneling conductance
elements.2211.03045_19cab649241814ca985a921950538: However for PMP, the leakage of the states towards the ends preserve the coupling to the leads, making the protocol immune to this vulnerability
elements.2211.03045_b8534e6eb905bbdec024e4be26376: Therefore, the PMP which is relatively easier to implement in an experimental setup will be the more suitable protocol for the detection.
elements.2211.03045_743b5b3d6ebf01b93bc46ca39a7cf: Our moving protocol combined with existing local tunneling conductance measurement provides a way to differentiate the MBS from the ps-ABS and quasi-MBS
elements.2211.03045_a7c6597da742f3f09b7d338cd0584: This different response of ZBP under moving protocol clearly distinguishes trivial ZBP from topological ones.

elements.2211.03045_0d45b9171b1b93e06cbee96368d15: We also thank J. Carlos Egues and Poliana H. Penteado for the fruitful discussion.
elements.2211.03045_f117c792ccaec40e1e341ebf10afd: To calculate the topological quantum number, we briefly discuss the scattering matrix method here
elements.2211.03045_f5e58403e4907cb13023d8e6c9524: A scattering matrix characterises a linear relation between the outgoing wave amplitudes and the incoming wave amplitudes at each energy.
elements.2211.03045_723d355dffde6c3f4ec087b74d7a1: is for amplitudes of the waves moving towards (from) the scatterer and the subscript
elements.2211.03045_09c1106c14c65f31d5508f7136740: is for waves on the left (right) of the scatterer
elements.2211.03045_c5fb544d693a9056ee9a8b22fe773: We can express the scattering matrix in terms of transmission and reflection amplitudes in the following form:
elements.2211.03045_b811994ca4316abf837e4eb33561b: The transfer matrix relates the wave amplitudes on the right-hand side to the left-hand side of the sample.
elements.2211.03045_f5870fc0506d33b14c5cbd74b7086: ), one can express the elements of transfer matrix in terms of the elements of scattering matrix as follows:
